result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Leroy Jacobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven Leroy Jacobs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven Leroy Jacobs was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Steven Leroy Jacobs was found guilty of Stalking [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Steven Leroy Jacobs was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All Counts to run Concurrent.
Counts 2, 3 and 6 dismissed.
Defendant to report to Probation today September 11, 2015 by 1:30 p.m.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Counts 4 and 5

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Anger Management/Domestic Abuse Assessment if requested.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO CONTACT with Victim unless for reason of Child Placement.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow recommendations of Agent.

Condition time, STAYED.
Huber granted for work, child care and treatment.
Concurrent with: Counts 4 and 5

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-All Counts to run Concurrent.
-Counts 2, 3 and 6 dismissed.
-Defendant is entitled to 111 days credit under 973.155.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Steven Leroy Jacobs appeared. Case called at 11:35 am. Court reviews files. Parties would like to proceed. ADA Nieskes makes sentencing recommendations. Victim makes statement. Atty Chapman responds. Def's father makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court orders: 
Count #1 - 1 year probation s/w
Count #4 - 3 years probation i/s 1.5 yrs i/c 2 yrs e/s 
Count #5 - 3 years probation i/s 2 yrs i/c 3 yrs e/s 
To run concurrent
- 249 Days Jail STAYED. Huber granted for work, child care and treatment
- Court Costs
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA within 30 Days
- Anger management/domestic abuse assessment if requested
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not contact with Victim unless for reasons of Child Placement
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Sign up for probation by 9/11/2015 at 1:30 pm
- Random UA's and PBT's
- Pay Supervision Fees.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent

ADDRESS INFO for Steven Leroy Jacobs
Current: 740 Shane Park Circle, Unit 6, Prescott, WI 54021 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2015)
Prior: 450 White Pine Lane, Somerset, WI 54025 United States

Bond is to be Co-Signed by Defendant  SURETY NAME:  Jessica J. Prindle


_X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $5,000 CASH and $45,000 signature bond
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

Bond is to be Co-Signed by Jessica J. Prindle, 740 Shane Park Circle, Unit 6, Prescott, WI 54021: 651-210-0996       
- DE to reside with the co-signer, Jessica J. Prindle, 740 Shane Park Circle, Unit 6, Prescott, WI 54021: 651-210-0996              

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Nicole Jacobs or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- There needs to be a Third Party, with a written agreement in regards to setting up visitation with child. However a third party may contact Nicole Jacobs on behalf of Steven Jacobs and Z.L.J., who is a minor son of Steven Jacobs and Nicole Jacobs. Any agreement for such visitation shall be in writing.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Steven Leroy Jacobs appeared. Case called at 3:33 pm. Atty Chapman recites agreement. No objection from ADA Nieskes. Count #1 is amended to a simple Mis. Battery. Amended Information will be filed prior to sentencing. Counts 4 and 5 are amended to be with out the domestic abuse enahncer. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count 1, amended count 4 and amended count 5. Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended count 1, amended count 4 and amended count 5. Court dismisses other counts. Bond continues. Address confirmed. Court orders PSI. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Weniger, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Steven Leroy Jacobs appeared from jail. Case called at 3:30 p.m. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Provided court and attorney with a copy of a criminal complaint on a previous case. Atty Chapman makes statement. Probation was successfully completed on Battery case and mother is in the courtroom and would co-sign. ADA Nieskes still is requesting a cash bond. Makes statement regarding the victim and the child. Asking at least for $10,000 cash if bond is reduced. Atty Chapman makes statement. Court states did not get transcript. ADA Nieskes states that mother is not concerned with the safety of the child. Court states that they need a third party listed on the bond for visitation and needs to be put in writing. No problem with any of the parties if the attorneys are not present and the defendant does not need to be brought up when co-signer comes to speak with the court.  Status conference scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Assistant District Attorney Michael Nieskes.
Bail/bond hearing on December 18, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Steven Leroy Jacobs appeared from jail. Case called at 3:44 p.m. Atty Chapman has a copy of the information. Court goes over charges, penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Count 6 has been added. Atty Chapman is not requesting speedy trial and pleads NG to all 6 counts. Set for PTC. Arguement to bond. Possible to post $2,000 cash. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Sexual assault charge will be amended. States $50,000 is an appropriate bond amount. Atty Chapman states that defendant works for father and would reside with family if gets released. Court will take bond request under consideration and won't rule out a possible co-signer. Court would like additional information on a previous charge. ADA Nieskes has been asked by Atty Chapman to contact victim regarding child visitation issues. Bond continues. hml  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
